headline.main: Berlin and London Broadcasts Give Versions of the Sea Battle; Berlin

docs.snippet: One of the war's most dramatic episodes was Wednesday's running sea fight between the Graf Spee and three British cruisers off the muddy estuary of the River Plate. By one of those ironies of which history is so often ...
docs.lead_paragraph: One of the war's most dramatic episodes was Wednesday's running sea fight between the Graf Spee and three British cruisers off the muddy estuary of the River Plate. By one of those ironies of which history is so often ...

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Dec. 14 --Foreign Minister Alberto Guani announced tonight that the government would permit the German pocket battleship Admiral Graf Spee to remain in the port of Montevideo beyond the customary twenty-four hours established by...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Dec. 14 --Foreign Minister Alberto Guani announced tonight that the government would permit the German pocket battleship Admiral Graf Spee to remain in the port of Montevideo beyond the customary twenty-four hours established by international law.
docs.abstract: Uruguay to permit Spee to remain in port more than 24 hrs despite Brit pressure; German speculation on fate if repairs delay departure

headline.main: BRITISH REBUFFED; Had Asked That Warship Be Required to Leave Within 24 Hours HULL HINTS CONSULTATION Indicates the American States May Confer on Waging of Fight Within Safety Zone U.S. Procedure Differs British Cite Hague Pact URUGUAY PERMITS GRAF SPEE TO STAY Speculation in Berlin

headline.main: BATTLE WITNESSES LAUD BRITISH SKILL; Damaged German Battleship in Montevideo Harbor After Fight With British Cruisers

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES.RadiophotoAssociated Press Radiophoto

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Dec. 14--During all her long day of fighting yesterday sixty-two British seamen imprisoned below the decks of the Admiral Graf Spee crouched helplessly as British shells hammered the sides of their prison ship. They were released...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Dec. 14--During all her long day of fighting yesterday sixty-two British seamen imprisoned below the decks of the Admiral Graf Spee crouched helplessly as British shells hammered the sides of their prison ship. They were released here today.
docs.abstract: 62 Brit prisoners, crew members of 9 sunk merchant ships, freed; describe experiences during fight; merchant ship sinkings retraced

headline.main: 62 BRITONS FREED TELL OF SEA BATTLE; Graft Spee Prisoners Declare She Sank 9 Ships and Was on Ocean Before War Began 62 BRITONS FREED FROM GRAF SPEE Count 17 Hits in Day Younger Men Gleeful Retracing the Sinkings

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Dec. 14--Secretary of State Cordell Hull indicated at his press conference today that the American republics might consult on the question of possible invasion of the neutral sea zone about the Western Hemisphere in the fight between the...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Dec. 14--Secretary of State Cordell Hull indicated at his press conference today that the American republics might consult on the question of possible invasion of the neutral sea zone about the Western Hemisphere in the fight between the German pocket battleship Admiral Graf Spee and three British cruisers.
docs.abstract: Indicates Amer nations conf may be held on neutral zone invasion in case of battleship Adm Graf Spee fight, press conf

headline.main: AMERICAS TO SCAN DATA ON SEA FIGHT; Facts Are Sought on Whether Spee and British Ships Met Within Neutral Zone MATTER OF PROTEST OPEN Hull Indicates Consultation Is Likely if Hemisphere Belt Was Violated at Start

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Dec. 15 (UP)--A saga of the first major naval battle of the European war was told tonight from a hospital bed by a wounded German sailor who said he wanted only to return to the high seas with his ship.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Dec. 15 (UP)--A saga of the first major naval battle of the European war was told tonight from a hospital bed by a wounded German sailor who said he wanted only to return to the high seas with his ship.
docs.abstract: Spee's former captives deny Brit fired gas shells
